channel.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
channel.description:
SO as noble I have the ability to double vote to pardon or execute once a turn and twice a game
So here are the scenarios where I can use this ability .
1)We have managed to get an unseen on trial . Ok but because this has happened we likely already have a majority over unseen , so its not needed .
2)The unseen have got someone good on the stand because they have a majority . I cunningly use my ability to stop them and the bd is saved . The Unseen then put up another random bd , or me , and hang me .
3) Someone nobody is sure about is on the stand , I can use my ability but I have no more info than anyone else , possibly less as I have no investigative ability of my own .
I just don't see the point in this . Has anyone got something I am missing ?

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: Bart_Auringer
item.description:
I’ll agree on early game being boring.

There is nothing to do other than annoy people.

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
I wasn’t saying the same abilities for noble and aristocrat are bad. I was just stating that.

And maybe insanely over powered was an exaggeration. But I do think late game noble/aristocrat is OP. Not saying that’s a bad thing, it’s actually good because it balances out him being useless in the beginning.

My only complaint is that early game it’s very boring to be noble. You have to wait till mid to late game to impact the game much. Provided you survive to that point.

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
CN73DRUMMER:

Noble and aristocrat have the exact same abilities. So you can’t tell if they’re turned or not.

how is this bad?

CN73DRUMMER:

Noble is pointless early game when you don’t know who is what. But noble is insanely overpowered late game. So basically you have to be bored and hope you survive until there are 5 or 6 people left, then you hold all the cards. But there is nothing you can do until then

it is in no way insanely over powered. It cannot protect itself from votes, it’s abilities are limited use, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
I didn’t read any responses because I’m lazy. But I figured this is a good place to complain about noble.

  1. Noble and aristocrat have the exact same abilities. So you can’t tell if they’re turned or not.

  2. Noble is pointless early game when you don’t know who is what. But noble is insanely overpowered late game. So basically you have to be bored and hope you survive until there are 5 or 6 people left, then you hold all the cards. But there is nothing you can do until then

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
They can’t. They need 5 votes but only have 4 because they already used the 5th

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
So the evils just put the noble up instead ?

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
Vandalay:

So, 4 BD 3 Unseen 1 evil king.

King fingers to get one BD onto the stand… he no longer has a finger, but there’s now 4 evils and 3 BDs voting on the pardon/execute poll.

And then assuming the unseen can’t even kill, the finger is never needed again.

4 evils execute, 3 BD pardon. With your ability, 4 pardons, and a tie in the vote gets a pardon.
and then evil can’t get them back up because the king can’t sue royal finger again

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
All the suggested things so far seem to be " in this very convoluted scenario you might possibly do something good . "
The same abilities on a aristocrat have a lot more weight .
You can pull of an execute on someone with a bit of stealth .

Not even sure , if I pardon using ability , can the unseen just put him straight up again and exe when I cant use the ability …

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
RopeStringFace:

example: unseen are able to just barely have majority thanks to royal finger, you put the BD of the stand and then no more royal finger

umm… they don’t need it once they’ve gotten someone onto the stand

So, 4 BD 3 Unseen 1 evil king.
King fingers to get one BD onto the stand… he no longer has a finger, but there’s now 4 evils and 3 BDs voting on the pardon/execute poll.

And then assuming the unseen can’t even kill, the finger is never needed again.

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
you can counter act an evil king push, and then the king cannot put them back on the stand with royal finger.

example: unseen are able to just barely have majority thanks to royal finger, you put the BD of the stand and then no more royal finger

another example: your use of royal decree prevents the unseen from taking control of the court and executing prince before he kills one of them

another: your court order thing prevents unseen from mentally starting a band wagon (people less likely to be the first person to vote in a band wagon)

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
newarkinvaders:

this ability is only as good as the player that gets it

a prince that only repeatedly jails the sheriff for protection is worse than any other BD class in the hands of a mediocre player

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
I know this is why I particularly don’t like it , your putting extra power to a player that has less information , this ability is only as good as the player that gets it , if the noble is the one getting sucked in then it causes twice as much grief , if the noble saves a bd with this because he is more switched on the unseen will just shout aristocrat and hang the noble instead .

There’s very little social skill involved with the social class .

Read full topic

item.title: A noble buy pointless gesture
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
It’s mostly about overcoming trickery, and betting on your instincts over your teams instincts. When it’s 4BD vs 3 unseen, and you are 80% sure the unseen just tricked someone, that’s your time to save your teammate and convince the others of who you think is really evil.

Read full topic
